main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted in Saratoga Springs, New York, on June 21, 1967.
interesting points: The object first appeared approximately 15 degrees above the southern horizon as a bright light, It remained in sight for about 10 minutes while moving mostly to the west, Other witnesses observed the object alongside the primary witness, It was described as brighter than the stars and emitted a sound resembling a 'whishing noise', Despite the brightness, the object could not be distinguished clearly before it disappeared.
sighted object: a bright unidentified light in the sky
witness description: The primary witness was a 12-year-old boy who had a good knowledge of astronomy.
